techmeme.title: Midjourney launches V1, its first AI video generation model, letting subscribers animate images via its website; video jobs will cost ~8x more than image jobs (Carl Franzen/VentureBeat)
Source: Meta is in advanced talks to hire Nat Friedman and Daniel Gross to work on its AI efforts (The Information)
Texas Instruments plans to spend $60B+ on US semiconductor plants, including two new factories in Texas, and says its long-term spending plan remains unchanged (Bloomberg)
Sources: Microsoft plans to announce thousands of job cuts, particularly in sales, early next month after the end of its fiscal year (Bloomberg)
Sources: Microsoft is prepared to walk away from high-stakes talks with OpenAI if they cannot agree on critical issues, such as the size of Microsoft's stake (Financial Times)
